data.enText: to be the first person to become aware that a particular place or thing exists

data.chText: 人们把发现夏威夷的功劳归于库克。
data.enText: Cook is credited with discovering Hawaii.

data.chText: 全世界的科学家都在努力寻找治疗艾滋病的方法。
data.enText: Scientists around the world are working to discover a cure for AIDS.
to find sb/sth that was hidden or that you did not expect to find

data.chText: 警方搜查这栋房子时发现里面藏有一大批毒品。
data.enText: Police discovered a large stash of drugs while searching the house.

data.chText: 我们在围绕这个海岛航行时发现了这个海滩。
data.enText: We discovered this beach while we were sailing around the island.

data.chText: 人们发现他原来藏在棚屋里。
data.enText: He was discovered hiding in a shed.

data.chText: 人们发现她死在利兹她的家里。
data.enText: She was discovered dead at her home in Leeds.
to find out about sth; to find some information about sth

data.chText: 我刚知道有悬挂式滑翔运动！
得知他不识字真令人震惊。
data.enText: It was a shock to discover (that) he couldn't read.

data.chText: 我们一直弄不清楚她为什么辞职。
data.enText: We never did discover why she gave up her job.

data.chText: 后来查明这些日记是伪造的。
data.enText: It was later discovered that the diaries were a fraud.

data.chText: 后来才了解到他患了重病。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He was later discovered to be seriously ill.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。

data.enText: to be the first person to realize that sb is very good at singing, acting, etc. and help them to become successful and famous

data.chText: 这个歌唱家在上学的时候就受到赏识了。
data.enText: The singer was discovered while still at school.

simple_means.memory_skill: dis 除去 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 除去覆盖物 → 发现

tr: get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally
example: I learned that she has two grown-up children
I see that you have been promoted

tr: identify as in botany or biology, for example

example: She found that he had lied to her
The story is false, so far as I can discover

tr: make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret
example: The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold
The actress won't reveal how old she is
he broke the news to her
unwrap the evidence in the murder case

tr: make a discovery, make a new finding
example: Physicists believe they found a new elementary particle

tr: discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of
example: She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water
We found traces of lead in the paint
the archeologists chanced upon an old tomb
The hikers finally struck the main path to the lake

value.def: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.

example.tran: 她发现他们已经逃跑了。

example.ex: As he discovered, she had a brilliant mind...
example.tran: 正如他所发现的，她冰雪聪明。

example.ex: It was difficult for the inspectors to discover which documents were important...
example.tran: 检查员们很难发现哪些文件是重要的。

example.ex: Haskell did not live to discover the deception...
example.tran: 哈斯克尔至死都没识破那个骗局。

example.ex: It was discovered that the tapes were missing.

value.tran: 发现(以前不知道的事实)

value.def: If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.

example.ex: A few days later his badly beaten body was discovered on a roadside outside the city.
example.tran: 几天后，他的尸体在城外的路边被发现，身上有被严重殴打过的痕迹。

value.tran: (偶然)发现;找到(一直在寻找的某人或某物)

value.def: When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.

example.tran: 第一个发现美洲大陆的欧洲人

example.ex: In the 19th century, gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 19 世纪时，在加利福尼亚发现了金子。

example.ex: They discovered how to form the image in a thin layer on the surface.
example.tran: 他们发现了如何在表面薄薄的一层上形成影像。

example.ex: ...the myth of Columbus as the heroic discoverer of the Americas 500 years ago.
example.tran: 500 年前哥伦布作为发现美洲大陆的英雄人物而具有的传奇色彩

value.def: If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.

example.ex: I wish I'd discovered photography when I was younger...
example.tran: 我要是早点接触到摄影技术就好了。

example.ex: Discover the delights and luxury of a private yacht.
example.tran: 体验私人游艇的乐趣和奢华。

value.tran: 初次接触(某活动并乐在其中)

value.def: When an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.

example.ex: The Beatles were discovered in the early 1960's.
example.tran: 甲壳虫乐队于20世纪60年代初为世人所知。

value.tran: 发现，发掘(不为人所知的演员、音乐人等艺人)

value.boxu_tran: discover, find, find out 都可以用于描述获知事实情况：He discovered the whole school knew about it...（他发现整个学校都知道这件事了），The young child finds that noise attracts attention...（小孩子发现吵闹能吸引注意力），We found out that she was wrong（我们发现她错了）。discover 比 find 稍正式，并常用于谈论科学研究和正式的调查。例如，可以用于表示发现治疗某种疾病的方法，还可以指偶然间的发现：This well-known flower was discovered in 1903（这种著名的花是 1903 年发现的）。找不到某物用 cannot find somthing, dicover和 find out 则无此用法。如：I'm lost — I can't find the bridge（我迷路了，我找不到那座桥了）。find out 可以指弄清很容易就发现的事实，但 discover 和 find 则无此用法：I found out the train times（我查到了列车时刻表）。
value.boxu_usage: You can use discover, find, or find out to talk about learning that something is the case. He discovered the whole school knew about it... The young child finds that noise attracts attention... We found out that she was wrong. Discover is a slightly more formal word than find, and is often used to talk about scientific research or formal investigations. For example, you can discover a cure for a particular disease. You can also use discover when you find something by accident. This well-known flower was discovered in 1903. If you cannot see something you are looking for, you say that you cannot find it. You do not use 'discover' or 'find out' in this way. I'm lost — I can't find the bridge. You can say that someone finds out facts when this is easy to do, but you cannot use 'discover' or 'find' in this way. I found out the train times.

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to cover, cover 遮, 盖；盖子
rootsaffixes.title: cover

partsOfSpeech.dec: cover 遮，盖；盖子 + age 总称 → 所包括的范围（或区域、数额等）
partsOfSpeech.d: 所包括的范围（或区域、数额等）

partsOfSpeech.dec: cover 遮，盖；盖子 + ed 表形容词 → 有遮盖物的；有顶的
cover 遮，盖；盖子 + ing 行为的产物 → 覆盖物
cover 遮，盖；盖子 + t → 隐藏的
covert 隐藏的 + ure 与行为有关的物 → 覆盖（物）；掩护（物）
dis 除去 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 除去覆盖物 → 发现
discover 发现；暴露 + y 表行为 → 发现
hard 硬的 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 有硬皮的〔书〕→ 精装本
slip 片 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 覆盖物；沙发套
soft 柔软的 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 软皮，软面
un 打开 + cover 遮，盖；盖子 → 揭露
dis 不，没有 + agree 同意 → 不同意
dis 不，没有 + appear 出现 → 不出现 → 消失
dis 不，没有 + honest 诚实的 → 不诚实的
dis 不，没有 + like 喜欢 → 不喜欢
dis 不，没有 + may 能够 → 不能做 → 沮丧
dis 不，没有 + obey 服从 → 不服从
dis 不，没有 + order 顺序 → 没有顺序 → 无秩序
dis 不，没有 + proof 证实 → 不证实 → 反驳
dis 不，没有 + similar 类似 → 不同的
dis 不，没有 + trust 信任 → 不信任
dis 除去；剥夺 + able 能 → 剥夺能力 →〔使〕丧失能力
dis 除去；剥夺 + arm 武装 → 除去武装 → 解除武装
dis 除去；剥夺 + color 颜色 → 除去颜色 → 脱色
dis 除去；剥夺 + courage 勇气 → 使失去勇气
dis 除去；剥夺 + cover 盖 → 把盖揭开 → 发现
dis 除去；剥夺 + place 位置 → 被夺去位置 → 取代
dis 分开，分离 + band 乐队 → 解散乐队 → 解散
dis 分开，分离 + organize 组织 → 解散组织 → 瓦解
dis 分开，分离 + pens 花费 + e → 把花费分开 → 分配〔财富等〕
dis 分开，分离 + tend 拉 → 拉开〔变大〕→ 膨胀
dis 分开，分离 + tract 拉 → 把〔心〕拉开 → 分心

meanings.td: 完全地；加强 ，用在含有“分开；否定”等意义的单词前

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis 完全地；加强 + annul 取消，废除 → 取消，废除
dis 完全地；加强 + cern 搞清楚，区别 → 识别
dis 完全地；加强 + miss 送 → 送出 → 开除
dis 完全地；加强 + part 分开 → 分离
dis 完全地；加强 + sever 切断 → 割裂
